alert.note: Alert for Arlington; Fairfax (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 02 at 5:17PM EDT until June 02 at 10:45PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN MONTGOMERY, NORTHWESTERN PRINCE GEORGES, NORTH CENTRAL ARLINGTON AND NORTHEASTERN FAIRFAX COUNTIES AND THE NORTHERN DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA... At 517 PM EDT, emergency management reported multiple cars stuck in flooding on Goldsboro road in Bethesda. Between 1.0 and 2 inches of rain has fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1.5 to 2.5 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Arlington... Bethesda... College Park... Langley Park... Bladensburg... Fort Totten... University of Maryland... Potomac... Hyattsville... Takoma Park... East Riverdale... Adelphi... Chevy Chase... Riverdale Park... Martin`s Additions... North Chevy Chase... Friendship Village... American University... Georgetown... Silver Spring... FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1.5-2.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Basement flooding can occur quickly and create a life-threatening situation. If you are in a basement, or a residence below street level, move to a higher floor immediately.
